pyPPG.example

pyPPG.example.ppg_example(data_path='', filtering=True, correct=True, savefig=True, savedata=True, savingformat='mat', savingfolder='temp_dir')[source]
This is an example code for PPG analysis. The main parts:

  1. Loading a raw PPG signal: various file formats such as .mat, .csv, .txt, or .edf.

  2. Get Fiducial points: extract the fiducial points of PPG, PPG’, PPG’’ and PPG’” signals

  3. Plot Fiducials Points

  4. Get Biomarkers: extract 74 PPG biomarkers in four categories:

    • PPG signal

    • Signal ratios

    • PPG derivatives

    • Derivatives ratios

  5. Get Statistics: summary of the 74 PPG biomarkers

  6. Save data: save the extracted Fiducial points, Biomarkers, and Statistics into .csv file

Parameters:

  • data_path (str) – path of the PPG signal

  • filtering (bool) – a bool for filtering

  • savefig (bool) – a bool for current figure saving

  • correct (bool) – a bool for fiducials points corretion

  • savedata (bool) – a bool for saving fiducial points, biomarkers, and statistics

  • savingformat (str) – file format of the saved date, the provided file formats .mat and .csv

  • savingfolder (str) – location of the saved data

Returns:

fiducial points, a dictionary where the key is the name of the fiducial pints and the value is the list of fiducial points

Example:

from pyPPG import ppg_example

# run example code
ppg_example(savedata=True, savefig=True)

pyPPG.PPG class

class pyPPG.PPG(s)[source]

Bases: object

This is class for the input PPG parameters.

Parameters:

s (DotMap) –

a struct of PPG signal:

  • s.v: a vector of PPG values

  • s.fs: the sampling frequency of the PPG in Hz

  • s.name: name of the record

  • s.v: 1-d array, a vector of PPG values

  • s.fs: the sampling frequency of the PPG in Hz

  • s.filt_sig: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG values

  • s.filt_d1: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG’ values

  • s.filt_d2: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG” values

  • s.filt_d3: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG’” values

pyPPG.preproc

pyPPG.preproc.Preprocessing(s: DotMap, filtering: bool)[source]

The function calculates the preprocessed PPG, PPG’, PPG”, and PPG’”.

Parameters:

s (DotMap) – a struct of PPG signal: - s.v: a vector of PPG values - s.fs: the sampling frequency of the PPG in Hz

Returns:

filt_sig, filt_d1, filt_d2, filt_d3: preprocessed PPG, PPG’, PPG”, and PPG’”

pyPPG.fiducials

class pyPPG.fiducials.FiducialPoints(s: PPG)[source]

The purpose of the FiducialPoints class is to calculate the fiducial points.

Parameters:

s (pyPPG.PPG object) – a struct of PPG signal

pyPPG.biomarkers

class pyPPG.biomarkers.Biomarkers(s: PPG, fiducials: DataFrame)[source]

Bases: object

The purpose of the Biomarkers class is to calculate the ppg biomarkers.

Parameters:

  • s (pyPPG.PPG object) – a struct of PPG signal

  • fiducials (DataFrame) –

    a dictionary where the key is the name of the fiducial pints and the value is the list of fiducial points PPG Fiducials Points.

    • PPG signal: List of pulse onset, systolic peak, dicrotic notch, diastolic peak

    • 1st derivative: List of points of 1st maximum and minimum in 1st derivitive between the onset to onset intervals (u,v)

    • 2nd derivative: List of maximum and minimum points in 2nd derivitive between the onset to onset intervals (a, b, c, d, e)

    • 3rd derivative: List of points of 1st maximum and minimum in 3rd derivitive between the onset to onset intervals (p1, p2)

get_biomarkers()[source]

This function returns the PPG biomarkers.

Returns:

bm_vals: dictionary with values of biomarkers in different categories:

  • bm_ppg_sig: biomarkers of the PPG signal

  • bm_sig_ratios: biomarkers of the Signal ratios

  • bm_ppg_derivs: biomarkers of the PPG derivatives

  • bm_derivs_ratios: biomarkers of the Derivatives ratios

bm_defs: dictionary with name, definition and unit of biomarkers in different categories:

  • def_ppg_sig: description of the PPG signal

  • def_sig_ratios: description of the Signal ratios

  • def_ppg_derivs: description of the PPG derivatives

  • def_derivs_ratios: description of the Derivatives ratios

pyPPG.ppg_sqi

pyPPG.ppg_sqi.ppgSQI(ppg: list, fs: int, ann_ppg: list)[source]

PPG Signal Quality Index based on beat template correlation.

Parameters:

  • ppg – a vector of PPG values

  • fs (int) – Samples frequency

  • ann_ppg (list) – PPG annotation time(samples)

Returns:

psqi: PPG Signal Quality Index

Reference:

Original Matlab implementation: Qiao Li, November 10, 2014. https://github.com/MIT-LCP/PhysioNetChallengePublic/blob/master/2015/sample-submission/ppgSQI.m

Author: Marton A. Goda – Faculty of Biomedical Engineering, Technion – Israel Institute of Technology, Haifa, Israel (August 2022)

Load PPG data function load the raw PPG data.

  • filtering (bool) – a bool for filtering

Return s:

a struct of PPG signal:

  • s.v: a vector of PPG values

  • s.fs: the sampling frequency of the PPG in Hz

  • s.name: name of the record

  • s.v: 1-d array, a vector of PPG values

  • s.fs: the sampling frequency of the PPG in Hz

  • s.filt_sig: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG values

  • s.filt_d1: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG’ values

  • s.filt_d2: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG” values

  • s.filt_d3: 1-d array, a vector of the filtered PPG’” values

pyPPG.datahandling.plot_fiducials(s: PPG, fiducials: DataFrame)[source]

Plot fiducial points of the filtered PPG signal.

Parameters:

  • s (pyPPG.PPG object) – a struct of PPG signal

  • fiducials (DataFrame) – a dictionary where the key is the name of the fiducial pints and the value is the list of fiducial points.

pyPPG.datahandling.save_data(s: PPG, fiducials: DataFrame, bm_vals: dict, bm_defs: dict, bm_stats: dict, savingformat: str, savingfolder: str)[source]

Save the results of the filtered PPG analysis.

Parameters:

  • s (DotMap) – a struct of PPG signal

  • fiducials (DataFrame) – a dictionary where the key is the name of the fiducial pints and the value is the list of fiducial points

  • biomarkers_vals (dict) –

    dictionary with values of biomarkers in different categories:

    • bm_ppg_sig: biomarkers of the PPG signal

    • bm_sig_ratios: biomarkers of the Signal ratios

    • bm_ppg_derivs: biomarkers of the PPG derivatives

    • bm_derivs_ratios: biomarkers of the Derivatives ratios

  • biomarkers_defs (dict) –

    dictionary with name, definition and unit of biomarkers in different categories:

    • def_ppg_sig: description of the PPG signal

    • def_sig_ratios: description of the Signal ratios

    • def_ppg_derivs: description of the PPG derivatives

    • def_derivs_ratios: description of the Derivatives ratios

  • Statistics (dict) – data frame with summary of PPG features

  • savingformat (str) – file format of the saved date, the provided file formats .mat and .csv

  • savingfolder (str) – location of the saved data
